main event: In September 1957, a green flash of light with red tails was observed in Upland, California, lasting for about 15 minutes. The object was reported to be at an altitude of approximately 2,000 feet with no sound reported.
interesting points: The report was submitted by Mr. James G. Hicks of Upland, California, and approved by Colonel Harry C. Patterson, Director of Intelligence.
The objects' shape, size, and formation were unknown, and no optical aids were known to have been utilized in the observation.
The sightings occurred on or about 2 and 3 September 1957 during pre-dawn light conditions.
The observer's identifying information was unidentified, and the information provided was not sufficient to permit any meaningful evaluation.
No physical evidence was available, and a preliminary investigation was pending receipt of further information through normal channels.
sighted object: green flash of light with red tails
